intro: Polygala sphaerospora, commonly known as the globe milk-vetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its distinctive spherical seed pods. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pink. It has a short lifespan and is often found in open grasslands and shrublands. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
